contentBackground.img: A group of employees in a company office building.

panelText.text:
• Conflicts of interest can occur when your personal interests are opposed to, or may conflict with, your responsibilities as an employee of Johnson Controls.
  • Whenever your circumstances change in a way that may cause a conflict of interest, you are responsible for disclosing the potential conflict immediately.
  • Outside work should not interfere with your responsibilities to Johnson Controls. You cannot use company resources, such as a laptop, printer or company facilities, for side ventures or personal projects.
  • If you have an outside job, or are considering one, and you believe it could have the potential to conflict with your job at Johnson Controls, you must complete a Conflicts of Interest Form online at http://complianceforms.jci.com .

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.
